column1: # Child is scared of sleeping alone

column2: You awaken late in the night to little [FROM.GetFirstName] attempting to crawl up into the bed. Murmuring sleepily, you ask what the problem is. [FROM.GetFirstName] responds that [FROM.GetSheHe] was scared by a bad dream and wants to come sleep with [FROM.GetHerHis] mother.
It was only a dream. You shouldn’t be afraid of such things.
You sternly tell [FROM.GetFirstName] that [FROM.GetSheHe] must return to [FROM.GetHerHis] own bed.
Bad dreams? I’ll give you something to be afraid of you little whelp!
A harsh word and a quick lash will teach this child manners.
You poor thing, come here
You invite the child to come and sleep with in the bed with you, at least for tonight.
[FROM.GetFirstName] starts to cry as the candle is blown out. When questioned, [FROM.GetSheHe] says that the ghosts come out at night.
Ghosts aren’t real. Now be good and go to sleep.
You reassure the child that such spirits exist only in stories.
Ah, but ghosts only haunt bad children who don’t mind their parents.
You use the opportunity to instill a bit of proper fear.
You have nothing to fear from ghosts. [FROM.Religion.GetHighGodName] will protect you from them.
You take a short time to read the child a few verses from the [FROM.Religion.GetScriptureName].
I don’t have time for such foolishness.
You leave the room. The sooner [FROM.GetFirstName] is over this nonsense, the better.

column1: # 3-5 Child refuses to share toys with fellow courtier kid/sibling.

column2: “Mine!” The word, so common lately, rings out once again. It seems this time [FROM.GetFirstName] steadfastly refuses to share even a single toy with [TARGET.GetFirstName].
You should share your toys, [FROM.GetFirstName]. It’s more fun to play together with a friend.
You encourage [FROM.GetFirstName] to share their toys with [TARGET.GetFirstName].
Actually, they’re mine.
You take the toys from [FROM.GetFirstName]. If [FROM.GetSheHe] cannot share then [FROM.GetSheHe] can do without.
Whatever.
You ignore the situation. It will work itself out, surely.
You nod approvingly at [FROM.GetFirstName].
It is good that they understand their prerogatives.
If I promise to buy you a new toy, will you share that one?
You attempt to bribe [FROM.GetFirstName] with the promise of something new.

column1: # 2-5 Child breaks something while playing with toys

column2: You hear a sudden crash coming from the entry hall. Upon investigation, you find [FROM.GetFirstName] has been playing with [FROM.GetHerHis] favorite toy and has knocked over a decorative bust. The bust was a family heirloom, although not particularly valuable.
This is why we can’t have nice things.
You take away the child’s toys.
Do you know what that was? That was a bust of your great-great uncle. Now it’s forever gone, and our dynasty is diminished from the loss. Now go to your room and think about what you’ve done.
You send the child to bed without supper.
Whatever.
You do nothing. You never really liked that bust anyway.
